content: for multi-color version switch to mc knit to marker k the first 8 9 10 11 12 stitches of the tip use a dpn to pick up the needed heel turn and place bor marker number of stitches along the heel flap edge once you have the right number of stitches note the bor marker should now be in knit like a m1 stitch so as to prevent holes the middle of the sole stitches published april 2023 version 1 5 4 yet another vanilla sock by alecia elia-higgins // pixelfey knits marker you should have two stitch markers now decrease row note the bor is now the side of the toe after sole stitches and before insteps row 1 knit to 3 st before marker stitches beginning of instep stitches k2tog k1 sm knit all instep stitches sm k1 ssk foot knit to end row 2 knit all stitches work foot row in stockinette knit all until the foot measures 1 5 1 75 2 2 25 2 5 repeat row 1 and 2 until original stitch inches less than desired foot length count is reach 56 64 72 80 88 toe for multi-color version switch to cc1 if keeping instep and sole markers slip them when you come to them row 1 k1 ssk k to last 3 stitches of instep k2tog k1 k1 ssk knit to 3 stitches of sole k2tog k1 decreased 4 stitches row 2 knit all repeat row 1 and 2 until half the original stitch count has been reached 28 32 36 40 44 total stitches work row 1 until 16 16 20 20 24 total foot setup stitches remain remove markers remove bor marker knit 14 16 18 20 finish 22 to side of toe place bor marker or replace existing marker with bor kitchener stitch the toe closed weave in ends and block published april 2023 version 1 5 5 yet another vanilla sock by alecia elia-higgins // pixelfey knits row notes this is an optional page for making notes as you knit and to ensure that your second sock matches your first stitch or row small medium large x-large xx-large custom type co stitches 56 64 72 80 88 cuff row 16 16 16 16 16 leg row 40 40 40 40 40 heel flap row 28 32 36 40 44 heel turn 14 16 18 20 22 stitches left gusset 14 per side 16 per 18 per 20 per 22 per stitches picked side side side side up not including corner stitch decrease until 56 64 72 80 88 stitch count achieved foot row estimated toe stitches 16 16 20 20 24 left at end published april 2023 version 1 5 6 yet another vanilla sock by alecia elia-higgins // pixelfey knits yarn notes whether you re using full skeins minis or scraps the following chart is intended to help you determine how much yarn you need at each stage of your sock knitting journey use the following chart
